{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3142159,"name":"","username":"crazrRobot123","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crazrrobot123/{size}/211176_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-08T23:34:22.961Z","cooked":"

Hi,

We are having trouble with our Omio X8.

The machine was working allright when suddenly the x, y and z axis stopped moving, we tried to reset the control box and the computer and it was the same. When we start the control box the steppers don’t lock.

I hope someone can help us.

Thank you!

I forgot to mention that when we input the S24000 M3 command in the MDI the spindle works correctly.

When you try to move it, does it reset like one of the home switches was hit? That would stop movement completely, and could be caused by a loose wire on one of the limit switches.

Sorry didn’t mean to reply to you. Meant for op

When it’s stuck you should power it off, try manually rotating the caps on the stepper and back it off if it’s hitting any of the limit switches. Any contact stops all steppers. The spindle still might run but that would normally be stopped as well when a limit is hit like that. Even a power off won’t fix it cuz the limit is still hit when you come back on. You have to get it off the switches, then power it back on. Be careful not to get it too close to the edges.

That happend to 1506’s Omnio last year. More or less any 40V, 10A power supply off of Amazon will work. The reason the spindle still runs is that it’s got a separate 110V feed; that’s why there are two power switches on the front of the control box.
